node.title: ParaView & 1D Models
node.bodyText:
Hi:
Running on Mac OS 12.3.1.  Updated Moose last week.  Using ParaView 5-10.1
Just compiled and tested the NavierStokes module test app.  All tests ran successfully except those skipped due to insufficient CPUs or "heavy".
The Exodus files for test problems that have a 2D mesh open and display correctly.  However, problems with a 1D mesh, (eg) '/ins/channel-flow/1d-rc_out.e' crash ParaView upon trying to open them.
The beginning of the log file has:
-------------------------------------
Translated Report (Full Report Below)
-------------------------------------

Process:               paraview [66211]
Path:                  /Applications/ParaView-5.10.1.app/Contents/MacOS/paraview
Identifier:            org.paraview.ParaView
Version:               5.10.1 ()
Code Type:             X86-64 (Native)
Parent Process:        launchd [1]
User ID:               502

Date/Time:             2022-05-25 13:52:45.3232 -0400
OS Version:            macOS 12.3.1 (21E258)
Report Version:        12
Bridge OS Version:     6.4 (19P4243)
Anonymous UUID:        6B69982D-923C-D0F3-59A2-68DD8259CA3C

Sleep/Wake UUID:       0A29A4C4-7E9E-4D05-8798-9AC573DE9F8E

Time Awake Since Boot: 11000 seconds
Time Since Wake:       6620 seconds

System Integrity Protection: enabled

Crashed Thread:        0  paraview  Dispatch queue: com.apple.main-thread

Exception Type:        EXC_BAD_ACCESS (SIGSEGV)
Exception Codes:       KERN_INVALID_ADDRESS at 0x0000000000000008
Exception Codes:       0x0000000000000001, 0x0000000000000008
Exception Note:        EXC_CORPSE_NOTIFY

Termination Reason:    Namespace SIGNAL, Code 11 Segmentation fault: 11
Terminating Process:   exc handler [66211]

VM Region Info: 0x8 is not in any region.  Bytes before following region: 4486238200
      REGION TYPE                    START - END         [ VSIZE] PRT/MAX SHRMOD  REGION DETAIL
      UNUSED SPACE AT START
--->  
      __TEXT                      10b669000-10b74d000    [  912K] r-x/r-x SM=COW  ...acOS/paraview

Thread 0 Crashed:: paraview Dispatch queue: com.apple.main-thread
0   libvtkioss-pv5.10.5.10.dylib  	       0x11bc11d8a vtkioss_Ioex::DatabaseIO::get_sidesets() + 9514

I can provide the entire log file if it would help.  Anyone else see this problem?
Thanks,
Joe Kelly

I believe we now have a compatibility issue with Paraview (>= v5.10) in regards to how we store sidesets.
Can you try Paraview 5.9? https://www.paraview.org/download/?version=v5.9
Thanks.  5-9.1 works great (except for error message about missing font family Courier).
@joe61vette you can also use later versions of paraview, but you have to select the legacy Exodus reader as opposed to this new-fangled ioss reader

node.title: Sbatch gives back "not enough slots"
node.bodyText: When I submit my slurm file for MOOSE to analyze, but when I get it back, I got an error log saying that my file took up too many slots.  I'd only requested 8.  Should I request fewer, or is this a problem with my program.  I'm almost done with a project, just need this to get run.
This seems to be an issue with your SLURM Scheduler and probably your allocation (i.e. not MOOSE). You probably should contact your HPC admin.
what does your job submission script look like? We have people familiar with slurm so we may be able to pick up an error

Dear @GeneralStarbound ,
I have never got that specific error, but if that helps, I share here a typical submit file that I use with SLURM:
#!/bin/bash
#SBATCH --job-name=my_job
#SBATCH --nodes=1
#SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=24
#SBATCH --cpus-per-task=1
#SBATCH --time=25:00:00
#SBATCH --mem-per-cpu=12G
module load tools/git/2.22.0
module load lang/python/anaconda/3.8.5-2021-Jupyter
module load tools/cmake/3.14.2
module add lang/cuda/10.1.105
source ~/moose-environment.sh
srun -n $SLURM_NTASKS --cpu-bind=cores --mpi=pmi2 ./c_pfor_am-opt -i my_input_file.i
Hope this can help you,
Nicolò

node.title: Unable to access all the elements through material object
node.bodyText:
Hi,
Using the FeatureVolumeVectorPostProcessor, I obtained the element IDs belonging to the features (e.g. precipitate, bubble). Now, I want to assign special properties to the elements belonging to the feature. However, through the material object, I cannot access the element IDs of all the elements in the domain when the code runs on multiple processors, but I can access all the elements when the code runs in serial. Here, I am attaching the material object file and the input file.
If you play with the file, you will notice that only a subset of element ids listed in the root node will be printed out when the code runs in parallel mode, whereas all the element ids will be printed when the code runs serially. When I tried printing the rank of the processor, it only printed the root node's rank, '0'. I want to access all the elements of the domain through the material object, which I do not know how to achieve.
MaterialObject.C.txt
MaterialObject.h.txt
Sample_input_file.i.txt
I figured out that only the root node can execute the print statement. There is no problem.
add --keep-cout to the command line call to have console output for all ranks
Thanks a lot!

node.title: Error when checking PETSc build
node.bodyText:
I am having trouble with getting PETSc to work according to the guidelines for building MOOSE.
When I run the command make PETSC_DIR=~/scratch/projects/moose/scripts/../petsc PETSC_ARCH=arch-moose check, I get the following error repeatedly:
./ex19: /cm/local/apps/gcc/9.2.0/lib64/libgfortran.so.5: version 'GFORTRAN_10' not found.

BASH_FUNC_module()=() {  _module_raw "$@" 2>&1
}
BASH_FUNC_switchml()=() {  typeset swfound=1;
 if [ "${MODULES_USE_COMPAT_VERSION:-0}" = '1' ]; then
 typeset swname='main';
 if [ -e /cm/local/apps/environment-modules/4.4.0//libexec/modulecmd.tcl ]; then
 typeset swfound=0;
 unset MODULES_USE_COMPAT_VERSION;
 fi;
 else
 typeset swname='compatibility';
 if [ -e /cm/local/apps/environment-modules/4.4.0//libexec/modulecmd-compat ]; then
 typeset swfound=0;
 MODULES_USE_COMPAT_VERSION=1;
 export MODULES_USE_COMPAT_VERSION;
 fi;
 fi;
 if [ $swfound -eq 0 ]; then
 echo "Switching to Modules $swname version";
 source /cm/local/apps/environment-modules/4.4.0//init/bash;
 else
 echo "Cannot switch to Modules $swname version, command not found";
 return 1;
 fi
}
BASH_FUNC__module_raw()=() {  unset _mlshdbg;
 if [ "${MODULES_SILENT_SHELL_DEBUG:-0}" = '1' ]; then
 case "$-" in
 *v*x*)
 set +vx;
 _mlshdbg='vx'
 ;;
 *v*)
 set +v;
 _mlshdbg='v'
 ;;
 *x*)
 set +x;
 _mlshdbg='x'
 ;;
 *)
 _mlshdbg=''
 ;;
 esac;
 fi;
 unset _mlre _mlIFS;
 if [ -n "${IFS+x}" ]; then
 _mlIFS=$IFS;
 fi;
 IFS=' ';
 for _mlv in ${MODULES_RUN_QUARANTINE:-};
 do
 if [ "${_mlv}" = "${_mlv##*[!A-Za-z0-9_]}" -a "${_mlv}" = "${_mlv#[0-9]}" ]; then
 if [ -n "`eval 'echo ${'$_mlv'+x}'`" ]; then
 _mlre="${_mlre:-}${_mlv}_modquar='`eval 'echo ${'$_mlv'}'`' ";
 fi;
 _mlrv="MODULES_RUNENV_${_mlv}";
 _mlre="${_mlre:-}${_mlv}='`eval 'echo ${'$_mlrv':-}'`' ";
 fi;
 done;
 if [ -n "${_mlre:-}" ]; then
 eval `eval ${_mlre}/usr/bin/tclsh /cm/local/apps/environment-modules/4.4.0/libexec/modulecmd.tcl bash '"$@"'`;
 else
 eval `/usr/bin/tclsh /cm/local/apps/environment-modules/4.4.0/libexec/modulecmd.tcl bash "$@"`;
 fi;
 _mlstatus=$?;
 if [ -n "${_mlIFS+x}" ]; then
 IFS=$_mlIFS;
 else
 unset IFS;
 fi;
 unset _mlre _mlv _mlrv _mlIFS;
 if [ -n "${_mlshdbg:-}" ]; then
 set -$_mlshdbg;
 fi;
 unset _mlshdbg;
 return $_mlstatus
}
_=/usr/bin/env


Output of mpif90 —version:
x86_64-conda-linux-gnu-gfortran: error: —version: No such file or directory

You are missing a Fortran compiler. I think you skipped the step to install MPI-wrapped compilers.
what platform are you installing moose on?
You should follow the getting started instructions from the main moose website. The page you are using is not immediately reachable, there are steps to follow first

Windows 10 is my platform. I did follow the steps for getting started, starting from the Windows 10 steps and then proceeding through Mambaforge3 and Conda. I may have missed the step to install MPI-wrapped compilers. Do you know where I can find the directions to install MPI-wrapped compilers?

The steps for WSL on windows 10 do not involve installing petsc. It is downloaded directly using conda
please follow these instructions
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/conda.html
Noted. Thank you. I will see if that works!
The tests are now passing. Thanks for helping orient me!
Step was unnecessary for Windows 10 installation when using conda.

node.title: Setting locale failed
node.bodyText:
When I try to run the compile and test code, which is as follows
cd ~/projects/moose/test
make -j 4
./run_tests -j 4
I keep getting an error that says that my setting locale failed, and that it will fall back on "c".  I am not sure what caused this bug or how to fix this.  Without this, I cannot tell if the program is running properly and it results in a mass of errors.

I have converted this issue to a discussion post, as this is more suited to that forum. I do not have enough information to give you suggestions and advice on what your issue is, so please let me know the following:

What is your platform? (Linux, Mac, Windows Subsystem for Linux - WSL)
Are you using the MOOSE conda packages (following the MOOSE Getting Started Instructions)?
Is this an error during build, or only during testing?
Can you please post a copy of the error? You can either attach a plain .txt file to your reply, or copy and paste it in the post if it isn't too long. To get proper visual formatting, please use the code formatting syntax for GitHub noted here.
It wasn't important.  We got the program working.
I do have a second question, probably also better for the discussion board, about using up too many slots
If you got it working, please post the solution in a new "answer" below so that it might help others. Feel free to post your other question as a new discussions post.

node.title: ComputeExtraStressConstant - Function input?
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
The following question:
We have a prestressed block and are only interested in the possible deformation (and strain/ stress change) until failure happens (e.g. by means of Mohr-Coulomb criterion).
Now there are various possibilities of initial "prestressing" via PressureBC, Applied Displacements as BC, etc..
I also came across ComputeExtraStressConstant, which however only accepts constant values.
Is there a reason why ComputeExtraStressConstant does not accept a spatial/temporal-dependent function (e.g. from a CSV, postprocessor, z-dependent) as input?
Kind regards

Hello
There is a prefactor option in that object so you can use a material property to define the value of the stress
And using a GenericFunctionMaterial you can get a material property that uses a function (spatial and temporal dependent) .
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/materials/GenericFunctionMaterial.html
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume,
thanks for your answer.
I also found this post regarding the usage https://github.com/idaholab/moose/discussions/17410.
But how can I use a function to define this prefactor in at least 3 (or all 6) components independent?
e.g. if I want to add:
stress_zz = z * rho* g, stress_yy =0.7 * stress_zz, stress_xx = 1e6 = const.
How should the 'prefactor' or GenericFunctionMaterial or the ParsedFunction look like to apply this ExtraStress?
I am not quite clear at which point I define the vector or tensor for the prefactor?
Kind regards

Hello
ok I missed that you wanted a component dependent prefactor.
The solution here will be for you to create a new material, which retrieves a tensor material property rather than just a Real material property. Copy paste the ComputeExtraStressConstant.C and ComputeExtraStressConstant.h to a new file name then modify it for a tensor prefactor.
Please let us know if you need help with that.
Then once you have that you can use a GenericFunctionRankTwoTensor to define the new prefactor.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/materials/GenericFunctionRankTwoTensor.html
Guillaume

Hello Guillaume,
thanks for your suggestion, it works fine.
I created my own material and filled the RankTwoTensor of extrastress with some functions from the functionParser.
I have omitted the prefactor, I can add it if needed.
Thanks a lot and greetings!

Hi Guillaume,
where as the coding worked fine`for me,
I have another question regarding the solution of the extra stress and the stress update due to ComputeExtraStressConstant material, but also in my material.
When I try to solve a simple problem, the extra_stress is not transferred properly to the stress tensor.
While xx, yy always work fine, zz doesn't work for smaller young's moduli.
Please see the attached image and the input-file leading to the image.

  type = GeneratedMesh
  dim = 3
  nx = 10
  ny = 10
  nz = 50
  ymax = 1
  ymin = 0
  xmax = 1
  xmin = 0
  zmin = 0
  zmax = 5
[]

[GlobalParams]
  displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
[]

[Modules]
  [./TensorMechanics]
    [./Master]
      [./all]
      add_variables = true
      strain = SMALL
      incremental = true
      additional_generate_output = 'stress_xx stress_yy stress_zz'
      [../]
    [../]
  [../]
[]

[BCs]
  [./no_x]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_x
    boundary = 'left right'
    value = 0.0
  [../]
  [./no_y]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_y
    boundary = 'bottom top'
    value = 0.0
  [../]
  [./no_z]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_z
    boundary = 'back front'
    value = '0.0'
  [../]
[]

[Materials]
  [./Elasticity_tensor]
    type = ComputeElasticityTensor
    fill_method = symmetric_isotropic_E_nu
    C_ijkl = '7.4e7 0'
  [../]
  [./stress]
    type = ComputeFiniteStrainElasticStress
  [../]
  [./extra_stress]
    type = ComputeExtraStressConstant
    extra_stress_tensor = '1 1.5 2 0 0 0'
    prefactor = stress_fac1
    output_properties = 'extra_stress'
    outputs = 'exodus'
  [../]
  [./fac1]
    type = GenericFunctionMaterial
    prop_names = stress_fac1
    prop_values = fac1_fcn
  [../]
[]

[Functions]
  [fac1_fcn]
    type = ParsedFunction
    value = '(z*1e3)'
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  end_time = 5
  dt = 5
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-10
  l_max_its = 20
  automatic_scaling = true
  compute_scaling_once = true
[]

[Outputs]
  exodus = true
  print_linear_residuals = true
[]

Kind regards

Hello
What is the definition of stress_fac1?
I suspect it's just that tensor components arent entered in the right order for zz
How did you implement the tensor prefactor? I still see a function for the prefactor, so a single coefficient.
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume,
for the example above, I just followed some earlier discussion here on Github [LINK] #17410)
The inpute-file above works with the normal TensorMechanics.
The ExtraStress is calculated using the z-value of each QP.
And as far as I could see, the ExtraStress also agrees with the calculated value.
Only with the transfer into the stress tensor there are problems. Stress_XX, Stress_YY are z-dependent and identical with the ExtraStress, only Stress_ZZ has a constant value for each element.
Kind regards

hello
I see it evolve as expected.
with this
  [./extra_stress]
    type = ComputeExtraStressConstant
    extra_stress_tensor = '1 2 3 4 5 6'
    prefactor = stress_fac1
    output_properties = 'extra_stress'
    outputs = 'exodus'
  [../]

I get this output which seems correct?
It has z dependence on every component of the extra_stress, of the expected magnitude. the 22 is the z component.

Note that stress_zz is not the extra stress. It s the total stress. And in your case you get strain which diminishes the stress and most importantly here I think it makes the stress more evenly spread.
Guillaume
@dschwen if you want to double check on my explanation

node.title: Exodus Output Specific ID
node.bodyText: Say I have a model with multiple subdomains, but I only want to output a specific subdomain/block id. Is there a way to do that in MOOSE? I looked through the documentation but it doesn't look like the exists in the docs.
The objects that will allow you (for which it makes sense) to do that will have a block =  parameter

node.title: Divergence of value(const value) AuxVariable in AuxKernel
node.bodyText:
Hello, everyone
I want to ask is there have some Auxkernel about caculating the divergence of value? i find one about vector divergence. #20554
my problem is konw the temperature field distribution, and want to use Auxkernel to get divergence of temp.
Thanks for your help in advance!
hao

Hello
I made one in this PR #20956.
You can specify the same field for each component to do the divergence of a value
It's not merged yet, it ll take a few weeks probably. So you should just grab the file and add it to your MOOSE.
Please let me know how it goes.
Guillaume

node.title: [Auxkernel][Converge]
node.bodyText:
Dear Moose users,
I want to ask a tiny stupid question.
As far as I know, auxkernel and its auxvariable just calculating some variables.
And the auxvariable and auxkernel should be nothing related to a convergence of a numerical calculation.
Am I right?
I am a little bit confused now because I added some auxvariables. And it contributes to the convergence of the entire calculation.
I didn't make any coupling from these auxvariables to other kernels or material properties.
To me, this is so weird.....

Hello
It's not necessarily unrelated to the numerical calculation. The auxvariables may be used in the numerical scheme to compute material properties for example. This all depends on how you write the problem in.
For example:
T is your main variable
equation : dT/dt + D(T) grad_T = 0
if you make D a material property you get an updated value throughout the nonlinear solve (by default)
if you make D an auxvariable you get an updated value whenever you execute the auxkernel for D. If you execute it on TIMESTEP_END for example, you will consider D to be constant on each time step, so basically your numerical scheme will lag D.
But the default for auxkernel is actually (for most) linear + timestep_end. So you will get updates the same way as a material property.
Guillaume

Thank you for your advice!
I found the error...
I used the wrong mesh....
Thank you!
